LeTip Summerlin - Business Networking Group, Las Vegas

LeTip Summerlin is an organization of professional business men and women dedicated to the highest standards of competence and service.

Our purpose is the exchange of business tips. Our members maintain the highest professional integrity at all times. Each business category is represented by one member, preventing competition within our chapter.

Our members help you network your business. Talk with a member and come as their guest, or just show up! Bring at least 30 business cards to hand out and be prepared to talk to our members about your business.

$130,746.67 IN REFERRALS WERE PASSED AMONG OUR MEMBERS IN 2016!

Business Networking Mixers

LeTip Summerlin holds an evening business mixer once per quarter. These are great opportunities to meet our members.

Our next mixer is scheduled for Tuesday, November 7th! Please join us at the PKWY Tavern in Tivoli Village (450 S. Rampart Blvd.) from 6pm to 8pm.

Make 2017 the best year ever for your business!

We are in need of business professionals to fill these categories:
Ad Specialties (Pens, T-Shirts, etc) - Pool Service - Landscape Maintenance / Contractor - Carpet Cleaner - HVAC (Heating/Venting & A/C) - Dog Groomer - Handyman - Printer - Jeweler - Painter

LeTip International

LeTip International, Inc. is the world's largest, privately owned, professional business leads organization. LeTip was founded in 1978 by Ken Peterson, an accomplished insurance executive who understood the powerful role that personal referrals play in the success of small business. Today, LeTip employs 15 Regional Directors who oversee more than 525 chapters throughout the USA and Canada. Peterson set the standard for referral organizations and LeTip members are known throughout the B2B referral industry for their dedication to the LeTip Program and helping one another grow their businesses. LeTip Chapters meet weekly to exchange qualified leads, build business relationships, develop strong presentation skills and become proficient networkers. Only one representative of any given profession is accepted into a chapter and members are chosen for their occupational expertise.
